did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Publications, printed materials, photographs, and video tapes and reel to reel recordings.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection offers a depth of material related to fashion design in the later half of the 20th century with most dating from the 1990 to 2016.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Dorothy Schefer Faux, Cornell University Class of 1969, is a former senior editor of Vogue, an author, and entrepreneur.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection offers a depth of material related to fashion design in the later half of the 20th century with most dating from the 1990 to 2016. Material in the collection consists of lookbooks, Visionaires, designer interviews, VHS tapes and other media, and other publications and books related to fashion.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: Audio visual media that has been digitized: V-9679

Due to the fragility and potential degradataion of moving image and sound recordings, viewing and listening is limited to items that have been digitized. If an item is in another media format, you may request to have the item digitized for access. Information on ordering access copies may be found on the Divison of Rare and Manuscript webpage.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Dorothy Schefer Faux Fashion Collection, #8572. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information:
processinfo.p: Series in this guide were created based on original cataloging of the collection before it arrived in the RMC - lookbooks, trend reports, exhibit and other event publications, books, Visionaires, and promotional material were all grouped together and the majority of the individual items were numbered and those numbers were kept. Videos were renumbered according to RMC rules but the original numbers appear in the notes field as a reference.
Later additions (after Box 24) were placed into corresponding series but unless they were media, the items were not individually numbered.

p.ref: a. Bonnie Cashin: designer's season descriptions and/or illustrations
c. Fashion and Various Other Periodicals

emph.ref: Series V. Promotional materials and fashion show invitations

arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order by designer and then by date.

processinfo.p: Was duplicate # with LB181 Fendi, Spring/Summer 2000; # changed to LB188
There are two copies both are packaged in a CD case. No actual CD found in either copy, and fit of catalog into case suggests there never was one. 1/23/2014, HMM

scopecontent.p: Comes with CD titled "Fashion Exhibition" (CD is inside catalog)

scopecontent.p: Matchbook-style catalog with price list, in envelope.

did.unittitle: Ford: Creating Images for Forty-Six Years
Who is Gio? Giorgio Armani parfums

scopecontent.p: Two catalogs, cover page, and price list in portfolio inserted into a slipcase
Includes catalog with three loose color photographs in folder, closed with a twig
Four cards held together by a gold band; band imprinted "RUNWAY SUCCESSES CHANEL". Includes accessories
To be introduced February 1992. Look Book is undated; contains letter dated October 30, 1991. In a shiny black folder
Catalog and price list in mailing envelope
Catalog and price list in mailing envelope, addressed to Dorothy Schefer. Includes sports and accessories
Catalog and price list in mailing envelope, addressed to Dorothy Faux,. Includes sports and accessories
Catalog and price list in mailing envelope
Includes oversized card (New Year's 1993) from Serge Lutens to Dorothy Schefer

did.unittitle: Style.com The Best Looks of Spring 2001

scopecontent.p: Includes Calvin Klein, Lee Angel, Jean-Paul Gaultier, Marc Jacobs, Tuleh, Oliver Peoples, Miguel Androver, Christian Louboutin, Roberto Cavalli, Megan Park, Manolo Blahnik, Narciso Rodriguez, Oscar de la Renta, Sigerson Morrison, lambertson truex. Card in folder
Consists of separate cards in a slipcase
Spiral bound book of photographs, two to a page, numbered 1 through 70, mostly women's, some men's, no designer given but possibly Betsey Johnson.

scopecontent.p: Also contains the Fall/Winter 1988 accessories catalog

did.unittitle: Olfactive Trends for Women: An Awakening of the Senses
The Mademoiselle Report: Redefining a Generation
Bonnie Cashin: designer's season descriptions and/or illustrations

scopecontent.p: Now in binders, originally stapled packets, these written materials were handed out to buyers at the opening presentation of each season's new design line, by Bonnie Cashin. Includes one drawing and written descriptions by Bonnie Cashin and Philip Sills about the fashion designs for the upcoming season.

scopecontent.p: Exhibit took place on September 12 -16, 1989. In slipcase.

scopecontent.p: The Dale Sko Hack: Exploring Modes of Production and Re-Form Tactics and The Dale Sko Hack, Design Management: A Reinterpretation, a lecture at Istanbul Technical University, 4 May 2006, on the theme of Modes of Production and Design Hacking, by Otto von Busch and Karl Palmas. [Published by Nordisk Kunstnarsenter Dalsasen, n.d.?]
Interview by Grace Mirabella, published in conjunction with the exhibition Geoffrey Beene Unbound, The Museum at the Fashion Institute of Technology, February 14-April 30, 1994.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Council of Fashion Designers of America

scopecontent.p: Awards show program/catalog. Designers/celebreties awarded or mentioned include: Ralph Lauren, Tommy Hilfiger, Marie-Anne Oudejans for Tocca, Richard Tyler, Richard Bengtsson and Edward Pavlick for Richard Edwards, Kate Spade, Hush Puppies, Tom Ford for Gucci, Suzy Menkes, Isaac Mizrahi and Douglas Keeve, Robert Isabell, Lauren Bacall, Hubert de Givenchy, and Bill Blass.

scopecontent.p: Includes essays by Federico Fellini, Katia D. Kaupp, Yves Navarre, and Helene de Turckheim
Designers include: Azzedine Alaia, Manolo Blahnik, Romeo Gigli, Helmut Lang, Isaac Mizrahi, Sybilla, and Vivienne Westwood.
Includes essays by Nathalie Chahine, Catherine Jazdzewski, Marie-Pierre Lannelongue, Francoise Mohrt, Fabienne Rousso, and Francine Vormese

Designers included are: Dolce & Gabbana, Givenchy, Yves Saint Laurent Rive Gauche, Romeo Gigli, Missoni, Gianfranco Ferre, Emanuel Ungaro Parallele, Thierry Mugler, John Galliano, Bill Blass, Giorgio Armani, Chanel, Ralph Lauren Collection, Prada, Jil Sander, Mary McFadden, Gucci, Lagerfeld, Claude Montana, Christian Louboutin, Christian Lacroix, Ocimar Versolato, Richard Tyler, Badgley Mischka, Issey Miyake, Herve Leger, Isaac Mizrahi, Gianni Versace, Valentino Boutique, Oscar de la Renta, Zoran, Geoffrey Beene, Calvin Klein Collection, Judith Leiber, Jean Paul Gaultier, Sonia Rykiel, Donna Karan, Escada Couture, Moschino Couture, Marie Gray for St. John, Vera Wang, and Carolina Herrera.
